abook_menu_click_here: Click here to create a new address book
abook_pref_items_per_page: Number of contacts / groups displayed per page:
alternate_2: You recently requested the addition of an alternative address to your %%VERIF_GET_FROM%% email address.
alternate_3: If you own the said address and made this request, please enter the following code (without the brackets) in the interface:
alternate_5: If you did not submit this request, please just ignore this email. Without this code, the owner of the %%VERIF_GET_FROM%% email address will not be allowed to send messages with your %%VERIF_GET_TO%% email address.
clipboard_value_copy_failure: The data cannot be automatically copied. Press Ctrl+C to manually copy the selected text.
clipboard_value_copy_success: The data is copied to the clipboard.
dashboard_abook_feature_desc:
Thanks to the XandMail Webmail you can add all your contacts to the address book and seize a lot of information about them.

You have the possibility to create groups and use the quick search to search for contacts.
dashboard_feature_desc_1: Click on message(s), folder(s), file(s) or an event and move them to the desired location.
dashboard_feature_desc_3: A right-click on a message, a contact, an event or a file displays contextual menus providing rapid access to some functions.
dashboard_feature_desc_4: If you wish, you can use a vertical separation between the list of messages and the display of a message’s content. When the messages list is displayed, click in the action bar on More, then on Display vertical panes.
dashboard_feature_desc_51: The search engine can be accessed in two ways:
dashboard_feature_desc_52: A "Quick Search" mode. Type the word to search for and click on the magnifying glass (or press "Enter"). The engine searches for that word in all the messages and contacts and then displays the search results in a new tab.
dashboard_feature_desc_53: An "Extended Search" mode. Click on +. A new tab appears. Let yourself be guided by the system. Once the request is built, you can save it in order to use it again later.
dashboard_guide_link: To help you discover the main features of our solutions, you have at your disposal a Quick discovery guide
dashboard_mailinfo_welcome: Welcome to your online documentation desktop. Have a nice day.
dashboard_news_subtitle:
- You can now read/manage your external Email accounts in the Messages/Options pages. Configure your external accounts once and read the corresponding messages directly from the same interface.

- You can now organize your contacts in different Address Books (folders) : Professional, Personal, Hobbies...

- You can now create multiple personal Calendars and display them.

- You want to write a quick text document and save it on line? The Docs Space now integrates an online text editor.

- You can now search for Emails which contain some attachments (name, format, size).
Lastly, do not forget the general features facilitating the use of our products:
dashboard_question_remark: For questions or suggestions, please contact our support at support@xandmail.com
dashboard_welcome_message:
To help you more easily test our Web 2.0 Communication Suite, you will find different pre-stored content samples. Eg. you will find on the web storage module some documents to discover XandMail products and reach technical information. Don't hesitate to read them!
So, let's keep it short, ENJOY! If you need help or information, contact us. For commercial matter, you can also find your dedicated interlocutor in the address book module.
dashboard_whats_new: What are the main new features ?

Avoid losing your incoming messages.

dashbord_reach_maximum_quota_gigamail:
You're about to run out of space in your mailbox.
${percent}% of space occupied - ${currentSize} used out of ${maxSize} available.

Avoid losing your incoming messages.
Purchase the GigaMail service from your Control Panel or free up some space in your mailbox by deleting or archiving your messages.

password_help_text_10: does not contain words which can be found in a dictionary.
password_help_text_11: contains mixed uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers and punctuation marks.
password_help_text_13: only an ordered numeric or alphabetic sequence of characters.
password_help_text_1: Use this form to change your password.
password_help_text_2: For security reasons, new passwords are checked for strength and the following rules are applied:
password_help_text_3: The following elements cannot be used as password, alone or preceded / followed by only 1 character (letter, number, symbol) or by an ordered numeric or alphabetic sequence of characters:
password_help_text_5: your domain name (or part of it).
password_help_text_6: a combination of your login name and your domain name (or part of it).
password_help_text_7: In addition, your password cannot be made of:

preferences_add_new_contacts: Add new recipients to address book
preferences_add_own_address: Add your own address to the recipients
preferences_allow_applet: Allow Java applets in your messages
preferences_allow_javascript: Disable filtering of potentially dangerous elements of messages
preferences_auto_logout_incorrect: The automatic logout value is incorrect.
preferences_display_contact_displayname: Display the sender's Alias from the address book in the message list
preferences_display_folder_infos: Display the number of unread messages in the folder list
preferences_enable_bam_help: Allows sending attachments without including them directly in the mail, delivering instead to the recipient a LINK, from which he can download the attachment. The attachments of a size bigger than the defined limit will be included in the email as links and not as attached files.
preferences_enclose_original_message_onl: Attach the original message's files and attach the original message's text in a separate text file.
preferences_forward_display_original_hea: Add the original message's header above the original message's text
preferences_from_default: Indicate a different mail address to use as sender
preferences_include_message_as_attachmen: Attach the original message as an encapsulated message.
preferences_include_message_in_body: Add the original message's text in the forward message text and attach the original message's files.
preferences_include_message_in_body_with: Add only the original message's text in the forward message text (the original message's files are not forwarded).
preferences_keep_copy: Keep a copy of sent messages
preferences_leave_copy_msg: Leave copy of messages on server
preferences_reply_display_original_heade: Add the original message's header above the original message's text
preferences_replyto: Enter a different address to which to send the replies
preferences_rich_text_as_default: Rich text composition set as default
preferences_saved_relogin: The application must be reloaded to apply your modifications. Any unsaved changes will be lost. Reload now?
preferences_show_share_on: Always show new sharing by default
preferences_system_threshold_is: The system threshold is configured at
